result.execSummary:
The defendant James M Belke was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).
  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take (<=$500), a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant James M Belke in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Ted S. Szczupakiewicz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to counts 1 and 2.  Court finds the defendant gulity of counts 1 and 2.  Count #3 is dismissed and read in.  State makes recommendations.  Attorney Kershek makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following:  1    
Sentence of:
30 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 0 days).  Concurrent to each count. Sentence commences immediately.
Restitution: TOTAL of ALL COUNTS:  $233.24 to be paid to Roundys Corporation within 90 days, if not paid to be converted to a civil judgment.  
COSTS:  $253.00 to be paid in 90 days failure to pay will result in 5 days huber consecutvive 

The Court Orders the Following:  2    
Sentence of:
30 Days Huber with STANDARD RELEASE CONDITIONS.  (Credit - 0 days).  Concurrent to each count. Sentence commences immediately.
COSTS:  $243.00 to be paid in 90 days failure to pay will result in 5 days huber consecutvive
dated November 20, 2015 from Atty Mark Kershek  Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel

Defendant James M Belke in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.  Melissa Zilavy appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek moves for one more date.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for November 25, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Defendant to have no contact with any Pick N Save store.   Absolute sobriety, defendant is not to possess or consume any alcohol.  Defendant to comply with I.D. Processing

Defendant James M Belke in court with attorney Mark E. Kershek.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   NOT GUILTY PLEA ENTERED.  Hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 09:00 am.
Initial appearance on July 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.

Attorney Mark E. Kershek in court.   Defendant James M Belke did not appear.    District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Kershek states the defendant is having car troubles and requests a new court date.   State has no objection to an adjournment.  Court stays the issuance of a warrant until the next court date.  Initial appearance scheduled for July 20, 2015 at 08:15 am.
Initial appearance on July 14, 2015 at 10:00 am.
Request for adjournment filed by defendant/defense counsel
